Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: Spotlight on iOS 6 used to reside on the left home screen (left). With GEL, Google Now and search are located to the very left as well (centre and right).

image:image.image:title: Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: iOS is essentially an app drawer so the wallpaper is always present.

image:image.image:title: Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: Android and iOS are very different platforms, but there is an increasing amount of overlap in their design language.

image:image.image:title: Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: GEL has done away with the black app drawer background in Android. Now, the app drawer simply comes forward and uses the wallpaper as the backdrop.

image:image.image:title: Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: Right: Nexus 5 with GEL launcher. Left: Nexus 4 with the stock AOSP launcher. Notice the GEL launcher is much "softer" looking and incorporates the use of transparencies - eliminating contrast.

image:image.image:title: Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: The iOS notification bar makes ample use of transparencies - allowing the colours of any given app to bleed through. Backgrounds are blurred out to reduce distraction.

image:image.image:title: Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: Android's notification shade includes less obvious transparencies. Instead of blurring the background images it increases the opacity, and as a result it looks more like a curtain.

image:image.image:title: Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: Apple has changed the access point for Spotlight. Users now must swipe down with one finger on any home screen to access it. Though the placement has changed, the effect is much more subtle. The search bar is more Android-like. The darker themed keyboard more closely resembles the Google's

image:image.image:title: Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: Siri can be accessed anywhere by holding down the home button, not unlike the "swipe-up" gesture for accessing Google Now. Notice the transparent background and clean interface.

image:image.image:title: Posts - Converging mobile design
image:image.image:caption: The iOS 7 Control Center features the same transparencies as the notification menu.

image:image.image:title: Posts - How to migrate your data to a new Mac (and organize your digital life at the same time)
image:image.image:caption: Image courtesy of helped on Flickr

image:image.image:title: Posts - How to migrate your data to a new Mac (and organize your digital life at the same time)
image:image.image:caption: I recommend saving your documents to the Documents folder - not the top level folder. If you use iCloud Drive, these files will always be backed up to the cloud.

image:image.image:title: Posts - How to migrate your data to a new Mac (and organize your digital life at the same time)
image:image.image:caption: Removing applications on macOS using App Cleaner is very easy. Just drag the apps into App Cleaner and it will find all the associated folders for that app.

image:image.image:title: Posts - How to migrate your data to a new Mac (and organize your digital life at the same time)
image:image.image:caption: macOS will estimate how long it will take to complete the transfer. It can range from an hour to 30+ hours depending on how much data and if you’re using WiFi or ethernet. (Image source)

image:image.image:title: Posts - How to migrate your data to a new Mac (and organize your digital life at the same time)
image:image.image:caption: If you try and open incompatible apps, you’ll get this dialog box.

image:image.image:title: Posts - How to migrate your data to a new Mac (and organize your digital life at the same time)
image:image.image:caption: In your iCloud settings, you can chooses to sync ‘Desktop & Documents Folders’.

image:image.image:title: Posts - How to migrate your data to a new Mac (and organize your digital life at the same time)
image:image.image:caption: If you’re apps aren’t compatible with macOS Catalina, you’ll see this icon.
